page.title: 02HOUSING:LANGTON HERRING
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF{LANGTON HERRING} SITUATED 5 MILES WEST OF{WEYMOUTH}IS BUILT UP OF 66 HOUSES 2 FARMS,{HIGHER {& LOWER, A CHURCH, A POST OFFICE AND {THE ELM TREE INN. { }ONLY A FEW OF THE 128 RESIDENTS ARE ENGAGED IN LOCAL OCCUPATIONS SUCH AS FARMING , FISHING AND SHOOTING. THE VILLAGE HAS A BUS SERVICE DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS.MOST RESIDENTS HAVETHEIR OWN{TRANSPORT}TO GET TO WORK AND TO SHOP IN THE NEARBY TOWN.THE ONLY SHOP , THE{POST OFFICE}ALSO SERVES AS A GENERAL STORE FOR THE VILLAGE. THE VILLAGE{CHURCH OF ST. PETER} SHARES A RECTOR ({ROY WYATT})WITH THE OTHER NEIGHBOURING VILLAGES.HE LIVES IN{PORTESHAM.} {LANGTON'S}SOCIAL LIFE CENTRES AROUND THE{ELM TREE INN AND THE {VILLAGE CLUB. }
